intro: Dianthus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy carnation, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers with a distinctive white or pale pink center. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Dianthus pubescens is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
